emptyHint: Try pressing ⌘V (Mac) or Ctrl+V (Windows) to paste a screenshot
emptyPrivacy: All processing happens locally. Your images never leave your device.
tipFirstImage: Drag to adjust position, or add more screenshots
layoutTip1: Click a template to add it to canvas
layoutTip2: Right-click to ungroup and edit individual elements
bookmarkMessage: Hey! Like what you see? Bookmark me so you can find me easily next time! 💫
heroSubtitle: Turn scattered screenshots into clear, shareable images. Combine chat logs, annotate tutorials, document bugs — all in your browser.
expressionTitle: More Than Stitching — A Tool for Expression
expressionCase1Desc: Use screenshots to break down a complicated issue into clear, visual steps that anyone can understand.
expressionCase2Desc: Combine images to present how an idea evolved, from initial concept to final result.
expressionCase3Desc: Add annotations to turn vague thoughts into specific, actionable visuals that communicate clearly.
useCasesIntro: PictriKit is more than a screenshot tool — it's a visual expression tool for organizing and communicating ideas.
useCaseTutorialDesc: Create step-by-step guides with annotated screenshots
useCaseFeedbackDesc: Document issues and suggestions with visual context
useCaseThinkingDesc: Arrange scattered ideas into a coherent visual flow
useCaseConceptDesc: Combine references to communicate design ideas clearly
review1: Perfect for stitching chat screenshots. Simple and fast!
review2: No login required, privacy-focused. Exactly what I needed.
review3: Great for creating tutorial images. One-click copy is amazing!
featuresSubtitle: Powerful tools for combining and editing screenshots
smartAlignDesc: Combine multiple screenshots into one seamless image with smart alignment
annotateDesc: Add text, arrows, and shapes to highlight important areas
privacyDesc: Blur or pixelate sensitive information before sharing.
exportDesc: Export as PNG, JPG, or PDF. Copy to clipboard for instant sharing.
cookieMessage: We use cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to visit this site you agree to our use of cookies.
blogSubtitle: Tips, tutorials, and stories about screenshot stitching
article1Title: How I Used Screenshot Stitching to Communicate My Design Ideas to AI
article1Excerpt: I had a simple design idea but struggled to explain it to AI. By searching for design inspiration, stitching different UI concepts together, and adding text annotations, I finally made AI understand my vision and created a great website.
article2Title: Goodbye Complex Software: One Webpage for All Your Image Needs
article2Excerpt: Tired of downloading heavy software just to crop an image or add a blur? Discover how PictriKit replaces complex tools with a simple, no-login, privacy-focused online solution for all your daily image processing needs.
ctaDesc: Free, no login required, start creating immediately
article1FullTitle: How I Used Screenshot Stitching to Communicate My Design Ideas to AI
article2FullTitle: Goodbye Complex Software: One Webpage for All Your Image Needs
multiSelectNoRotate: Multiple elements cannot be rotated directly. Please group them first (Ctrl+G)
ucTutorialSubtitle: Turn scattered screenshots into clear, step-by-step visual guides
ucTutorialWhatDesc: A tutorial image combines multiple screenshots with annotations to explain a process. Instead of sending 5 separate images, you create one clear visual that shows the complete workflow from start to finish.
ucTutorialStep2: Upload and arrange them in order
ucTutorialStep3: Add numbers, arrows, and text annotations
ucTutorialStep4: Export as one clear tutorial image
ucFeedbackSubtitle: Show bugs and suggestions with clear visual context
ucFeedbackWhatDesc: Text descriptions of bugs are often misunderstood. A screenshot with annotations shows exactly what's wrong, where it happened, and what you expected. This saves time for both reporters and developers.
ucFeedbackStep1: Capture the issue and expected state
ucFeedbackStep3: Circle problems, add arrows and notes
ucThinkingSubtitle: Turn scattered ideas into a coherent visual flow
ucThinkingWhatDesc: Sometimes ideas exist as fragments — a screenshot here, a note there, a reference image somewhere else. Combining them into one visual helps you see connections, identify gaps, and communicate your thinking to others.
ucThinkingWhen4: Preparing for a discussion or meeting
ucThinkingStep4: Export as a single thinking map
ucConceptSubtitle: Combine references to communicate your vision clearly
ucConceptWhatDesc: Describing a design idea in words is hard. Showing a combination of reference images — 'I want this layout, with this color scheme, and this style of icons' — makes your vision instantly clear to clients, teammates, or AI tools.
ucConceptWhen3: Explaining concepts to AI design tools
ucConceptStep2: Arrange them to show your concept
ucConceptStep4: Share one image that tells the whole story
featuresPageSubtitle: Everything you need to combine and edit screenshots professionally
featSmartAlignDesc: Automatically snap screenshots together with pixel-perfect precision. Our intelligent alignment system detects edges and helps you create seamless combinations effortlessly.
featDrawingDesc: Add annotations, highlights, arrows, and freehand drawings. Choose from multiple colors and brush sizes to emphasize important areas in your screenshots.
featTextAnnotationDesc: Add text labels, captions, and explanations. Customize font family, size, weight, and color to match your style and improve clarity.
featCroppingDesc: Crop and trim images to focus on important areas. Precise visual controls with real-time preview. Confirm or cancel with keyboard shortcuts.
featBackgroundDesc: Choose transparent, solid color, or image backgrounds. Perfect for creating professional presentations or matching your brand colors.
featPrivateDesc: All processing happens locally in your browser. Your screenshots never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security.
featFastDesc: No uploads, no waiting. Process unlimited screenshots instantly with our browser-based technology. Works offline too!
featuresUploadIntro: Multiple ways to add your screenshots:
featResponsiveDesc: Works perfectly on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. Touch-optimized interface for smartphones.
featDarkModeDesc: Toggle between light and dark themes for comfortable editing in any lighting condition.
featMultiLangDesc: Available in English, 简体中文, 日本語, and 한국어. More languages coming soon!
featKeyboardDesc: Speed up your workflow with intuitive keyboard shortcuts for common actions.
featNoRegDesc: Start using immediately. No account creation, no email required, no hassle.
featFreeDesc: All features available for free. No premium tiers, no hidden costs, no limits.
featuresComingIntro: We're constantly improving PictriKit. Here's what's on our roadmap:
featuresReadyDesc: Experience all these features yourself. No installation, no registration - just open and start combining screenshots!
featuresTutorialCTA: Learn how to use these features with our step-by-step tutorial
tutorialPageSubtitle: A complete guide to combining screenshots like a pro
tutorialGettingStartedDesc: PictriKit is a powerful yet simple tool for combining multiple screenshots into a single image. Whether you're creating tutorials, documenting bugs, or sharing conversations, this guide will help you master all the features in just a few minutes.
tutorialNoInstall: No installation required! Simply open PictriKit in your web browser and start combining screenshots immediately.
tutorialStep1Intro: There are three easy ways to add screenshots to PictriKit:
tutorialStep2Intro: Once your screenshots are uploaded, it's time to arrange them into the perfect layout.
tutorialStep3Intro: PictriKit includes powerful editing tools to enhance your combined screenshots.
tutorialStep4Intro: Choose the perfect background for your combined screenshots using the right panel.
tutorialStep5Intro: Work comfortably with large canvases using zoom and pan controls.
tutorialStep8Intro: Once you're happy with your combined screenshot, it's time to save it.
tutorialMobileIntro: PictriKit works great on mobile devices too!
tutorialNextStepsIntro: Now that you know how to use PictriKit, here are some resources to explore:
tutorialUseCasesIntro: Learn how to use PictriKit for specific scenarios:
tutorialUCTutorialDesc: Combine step-by-step screenshots with annotations to create clear visual guides.
tutorialUCFeedbackDesc: Show bugs and suggestions with visual context that developers can understand.
tutorialUCThinkingDesc: Arrange scattered ideas and references into a coherent visual flow.
tutorialUCConceptDesc: Combine reference images to communicate your design vision clearly.
exploreFeaturesDesc: Discover all the powerful features of PictriKit
